newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian shares fall, ITC stock plummets.
newsitem.headline: Indian shares fall, ITC stock plummets.

text.p: ** (1345 GMT) - Indian stocks finish lower, weak undertone
** ITC share takes a battering, falls over 6 pct to 268.75
** B.A.T, Indian firms to review ITC operations on Nov 15
** National exchange index down 0.96 pct to 881.57, Delhi
index 1.4 pct, Calcutta 1.22 pct and Madras 0.15 pct
Share prices at major Indian bourses on Tuesday suffered losses, with shares of ITC sliding over six percent in nervous trade, dealers said.
The benchmark 30-share index of the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) ended 29.88 points, or 0.97 percent lower, at 3,062.84 after rising to 3,104.03.
Traders said blue-chip stocks took cue from a sharp fall in scandal-hit ITC shares.
The ITC stock plunged 18.50 rupees to 268.75 rupees on volumes of over 2.8 million shares traded at the BSE.
The share fell 18.50 rupees to 268.75 at the National Stock Exchange (NSE).
Late on Tuesday, Indian financial institutions and B.A.T Industries Plc, major shareholders of ITC said they would review operations of the firm at a board meeting on November 15.
The tobacco conglomerate is being investigated for alleged "violations by ITC Ltd to the tune of over $100 million," the finance ministry said.
Last week, the Enforcement Directorate searched ITC offices and arrested senior officials including two former chairmen.
The decision to review ITC's operations was taken at a joint meeting of financial institutions and B.A.T, the Industrial Development Bank of India said in a statement.
The 50-stock NSE index lost 8.56 points to close at 881.57.
The Delhi share index fell 9.74 points to 692.25, the Calcutta index 5.09 points to 412.45 and the Madras index 4.56 points to 3,111.45.
TISCO lost 6.25 to 165.50, SBI 3.50 to 215.0, Reliance 3.75 to 185.0, TELCO 12.20 to 395.75 and ACC 26.0 to 1,430.0.
